title: For Sale/Trade:  Colt 38 special Officers Model Revolver c.1926 Fine shooter
postcontent:
Cheapest cash price! Grips are worth 60-75 bucks. Old Colt Officers Model 2nd Model. It sure isnt the prettiest thing from the outside; but, it locks up in battery tighter than any revolver I have ever owned. No movement at all in the cylinder when the hammer is down! Shoots straight and handles +p rounds no problem. These bad boys were the best and still rank there with any revolver in the world.

Has a beautiful bore and cylinders are bright inside. Outside looks like, well, not so good. If it doesnt sell here by fall I am going to tear it down, bead blast, and parkerize it. 

Serial Number shows it to have been made in 1926. The last year for second generation Officer's Models. Trade and add $$ for SKS or Browning Hi-Power or GP competition pistol.

No shipping. Dont need the pain in my @##

title: For Sale:  SIG P228 NIB GermanTwo-Tone Nickel Controls Contrast Sights
postcontent:
I have a German (KG 1996) SIG P228 Two-Tone with nickel controls for sale that has never been consumer fired. I am the original owner and the gun just sits in my safe. It's time for me to convert it into cash for other projects. 

If you follow SIGs, you know what this gun has become. It is truly a legend and the price they are bringing these days reflects that. As time moves on, they are becoming harder to find in this condition. As a two-tone with factory full nickel controls, this is even more rare. 

On GunBroker, this gun would likely bring $1400+. I'm putting it on Armslist for a local buyer at $1100. I'm not interested in trades and the price will not change. Cash only. I can meet you anywhere in Indianapolis or within 20 miles outside of I-465. If you are South of Indy, I would go as far as Edinburgh. You must have an IN DL and sign a bill of sale. 

If you have in interest in SIG handguns, get this piece of history while they are still available.

title: For Sale:  Polytech "M14S" (M14/M1A clone) Early 90's
postcontent:
Apologies, my camera sucks. Pics are of actual for sale items.

The "why I'm selling this": the gun has been in the back of my safe since I bought it new circa 1993 or 1994. Nothing wrong with it, I just don't use it, and I can put the money to use elsewhere.

It's in good shape. Very minimal wear on the finish. I took it out hunting one year (only suitable gun I had then), but that and I think one range trip were it. More wear is from moving it from place to place than from shooting.

It's got at most 100 rounds through it. I don't recall any problems back when I actually shot it. I'd be up front if there were. Bore looks great.

I bought a "USGI" synthetic stock for it back in the 90's via mail order. Unlikely some Chinese cloned piece at that time, but I'm no expert on M14 parts, so I can only say what it was sold to me as. I glass bed the action to the stock, filled in the selector hole with the epoxy, and filled some of the gap for the operating rod with the same epoxy. The filled locations should be smoothed out, and stock should be sprayed with paint, but it's functional. I have the original wood stock it came with as well, no problems with it either, just wanted the synthetic one.

I've got four 20rd magazines for it, and a 5rd and one USGI magazine pouch to go with (pictured). One 20rd and the 5rd magazine definitely came with the gun so are Chinese. The other three I can't remember..I would hope USGI, but I can't tell the difference other than finish between them and the Chinese ones. There is some very slight surface rust on a couple of the magazine bodies. 

It has an S&K scope mount (no-drill, does not tie into the receiver bridge) on it. It's a "three piece" mount (upper and lower halves are separate as is the rail section) and I can't comment on how sturdy it is, just that it's there and I used it. Never did test for accuracy. 

I know there are purists out there, but not that long ago I was looking at the M1A series of rifles, and saw it said at least once that these Polytech guns aren't necessarily bad when compared to ones like the modern Springfield offerings, as the Polytechs are forged receivers (vs cast on the low-end present-day US guns). Again, I'm no expert, do your own research, but my understanding was that these can be a good base for a buildup.

Not interested in much for trades. I would consider some reloading components in partial trade, but I don't need much. Perhaps some rifle powder. Good on just about everything else unless you have some .308 bullets, and even that would depend on what they are.

Changed my mind. Would also take a GOOD plasma cutter (no 110V cutters, no HF/Chinese stuff) in trade. Would take an owner-bottle argon and/or tri-mix (for welding stainless) cylinder as partial trade as well. Just opening up ideas for folks. 

Asking $900. Contact me if you have questions or offers. I am uninterested in dealing with shipping, would prefer face to face. I do travel the I5 corridor from Centralia to Vancouver nearly every weekend if you want to meet somewhere along there.

These rifles feature a 14.5" Light Weight barrel with permanently attached DynaComp muzzle break for 16" total length and Spike's 12" BAR 4 Rail Free Float Handguard. Complete Upper receiver assembly.

Specifications:

The Spike's Tactical 12” BAR Rail is a 1pc free floating quad-rail that’s machined from 6061-T6 Aluminum with a barrel nut machined from 7075-T6 Aluminum and finished in type III Hardcoat Anodizing on the rail and barrel nut. The 12” BAR rail weighs in at 479 grams (16.89 oz.) and has an ID of 1.79”.

The BAR rail also features scalloping on the rails that not only saves a little bit more weight but also allows you to run this rail without any rail covers! This sounds like an outlandish claim to those who have had their hands cut up on other quad-rails that have been lovingly called “cheese graters”. The BAR also offers excellent heat ventilation, built in anti-rotation tabs to keep the rail and even the barrel nut from coming loose, and of course; sexy styling.

title: For Sale:  Glock GSSF Glock Certificate
postcontent:
I have a GSSF Glock Certificate that is valid until 2/27/15. The certificate is exchangeable for any Gen 3 Glock G17-G19-G22-G23-G26-G27-G31-G32-G33. 

You simply take the certificate to your local FFL dealer and he mails it plus a copy of his FFL certificate to Glock. Usually within a week or so, Glock sends the pistol to your FFL guy and you go pick up your pistol. There is no charge for shipping. Glock does state that it can take up to 21 weeks for them to mail the gun back but I have never heard of it taking anywhere near that long. 

The certificate is upgradeable to the Gen 4 Glocks (same models as previously listed) for an additional charge of $35. 

The certificate can be upgraded the the Gen 3 G37-G38-G39 models (these are the GAP 45 Glocks) for an additional charge of $21.

The certificate can be upgraded for the Gen 3 Glock G20SF-G21SF-G29-G30S-G30SF-G36 for an additional charge of $66.

The certificate can be upgraded to the “Tactical Practical’ competition pistols, the Gen 3 G34 or G35 for an additional $107.

There are other upgrade options but I have listed the most popular upgrades.

Keywords Glock G17 G20 G21 G22 G23 G19 G26 G27 G30 G30S G36 GLOCK G35 G35 G29 G37 G38 G39 G31 G32 G33

title: For Sale:  FS STEYR SSG P-III PROTOTYPE (P-III is correct)
postcontent:
For sale Steyr SSG PIII, PROTOTYPE, 7.62x51 (308 Nato). This rifle was built for and imported by GSI, Trussville, Alabama. It was one part of a special design SSG, which at the time was P-I, P-II, and P-IV. This is the prototype for the P-III, this is one of TWO that are known to exist. It was born from the Steyr SSG Match, with the addition of an H-S Precision Stock. This rifle was outsold by the P-I, P-II and the P-IV during it's production and subsequently production was halter due to being outsold and delays in stock production by H-S precision. This rifle has been fired a dozen times with factory ammunition. All the necessary documentation is available on the history of this gun. Price is $8500.00 and should be handled by an escrow account. title: For Sale:  Mossberg 12 gauge Cruiser JIC Dark Earth 3 inch 18 1/2 in Ported Cylinder Bore 6 Shot Trench Gun type Heat Shield Excellent Factory Demo 53301TU
postcontent:
Our # LG53301TU

Photo specimen is representative from this lot of shotguns, all of them are within 5 percentage points on their finish grade, excellent condition. We can furnish photos of any exact specimen upon request. Dealers, law enforcement, and collectors may take any number of virtually identical shotguns we have on hand at the same per-gun price and with no extra shipping charges.  Here is a very powerful weapon, one that the operator should keep well away from his face. Not a comfortable shooting weapon, unless someone is doing varmint control with Super Light 2 3/4 inch shells, but a powerful one. For a good balance between firepower and felt recoil, a 3 inch Magnum load with 1 1/4  oz. BB Steel Shot delivers 90 Pellets at 1400 feet per second from the muzzle and that figures the rough equivalent of 2 boxes of .17 Mach II bullets all in one shot. Consumers must be at least 21 years of age to own one of these, any shotgun with a pistol grip has Federal Status as a hand gun for age requirement purposes. This is Mossberg's JIC series Dark Earth colored Cruiser, the Persuader 12 gauge pistol grip variant of the tried-and-true Model 500 slide action with tang safety, easily employed by Left Handed Shooters. This listing is for the exact shotgun in the photos. JIC stands for Just In Case. The Persuaders are virtual duplicates of the proven Mossberg military 500 and 590 models. Factory specs are: double slide bar pump shotgun; 12 gauge 2 3/4 and 3 inch shells; 18 1/2 inch Cylinder Bore Barrel with 16 ports to reduce muzzle climb; Dark Earth special purpose dip type factory metal finish, with matching high impact desert polymer forend and pistol grip; weight 5 3/4 pounds empty; capacity 5 + 1 with 2 3/4 inch shells, or 4 + 1 with 3 inch magnums; overall length 28 3/4 inches. This specimen is what we call a factory demo, a showpiece for Mossberg’s sales team that has been in Mossberg Corporate custody until we got it. Surface detractions are negligible to minimal on this shotgun, as its photos show. We rate it as Excellent, perhaps Near Mint, but photos ought to suffice for our distinguished shoppers to judge finish grade for themselves. Often a person can spot the letter U stamped on the left side of the receiver above the serial number. Bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright and clean. This 500 JIC Cruiser comes in a relabeled Mossberg Factory Box with factory lock, instruction manual, NSSF and NRA flyers. It does not come with any extras besides the added heat shield. We have even outfitted it with a matching trench type heat shield. If this shotgun was test fired, it was fewer than 20 times. Mossberg only made a few of these; the 53301 number is our best guess.	We’re offering the Mossberg in the photos, however, or one of its virtually identical mates,    for only		$ 299.00.	Buyers must be at least 21 Years of Age; the Cruiser grip gives this shotgun Other Weapon status on the 4473 form. Local pickup by a civilian non dealer has to be a Tennessee Resident. Dealers in one state cannot transfer over-the-counter to a resident of another state on cruiser grip shotguns.

title: For Sale:  SMITH & WESSON MODEL 1905 (4TH CHANGE) EXCELLENT CONDITION!
postcontent:
We have for sale a Smith & Wesson Model 1905 (4th Change).

It's a 6-shot revolver chambered in 38 special.

This gun is in exceptional condition and hasn't been shot much at all.

It's at least 95% if not 98% and for its age the gun is unbelievably beautiful.

The bluing is near perfect, and it BARELY has a line on the cylinder from turning.

The grips have no cracks or scuffs and you can tell without a doubt someone has put this gun up and taken excellent care of it.

The gun is in such excellent shape we almost hate to sell it.

American Tactical sets the new standard in polymer AR lowers by introducing the new Omni-Hybrid AR-15 lower.

The new design is a fiberglass-composite polymer over a zinc metal insert. Designed to give extra strength in the high-pressure sections, the Omni-Hybrid surpasses military pressure and weight-bearing testing.

This unique manufacturing process produces a lighter weight platform, with the total weight of the Omni-Hybrid stripped lower being 8 ounces, a ½ ounce lighter than a traditional aluminum AR lower.

“The Omni-Hybrid lower has gone through all the pressure and weight-baring testing of a traditional aluminum lower with flawless results,” says Joe Calabro, Director of Marketing for American Tactical. “We feel like this new manufacturing technique will help set the standard for AR lower manufacturing.”

The Omni-Hybrid stripped lower has an MSRP of $49.95, making it one of the most cost-effective multi-caliber lowers on the market today.

13-7851 Since 1959, the venerable AR-7 has been the choice of U.S. Air Force pilots who need a small-caliber rifle they can count on for survival should they have to punch out over a remote area. Over the years, the AR-7's reputation for portability, ease of operation and reliability has carried over to the civilian world as well.

 Henry U.S. Survival AR-7
 Today, it's a favorite of bush pilots, backpackers and backcountry adventurers who, like their Air Force counterparts, need a rifle that's easy to carry but has the accuracy to reliably take down small game.

 Henry U.S. Survival AR-7
 Like the original Henry US Survival Rifle, our latest take on this innovative, semi-automatic rifle is lightweight (just 3.5 lbs) and highly portable. At just 16 ½" long (when all the components are stowed), it fits easily into the cargo area of a plane or boat or in a backpack. And because it's chambered in .22LR you can carry a large quantity of ammunition, without adding much weight to your gear.

 Henry U.S. Survival AT-7 x-ray
 When disassembled, the pieces fit inside the impact-resistant, water-resistant stock. Assembly is as easy as attaching the receiver to the stock, inserting the barrel and screwing on the barrel nut. In just a few seconds, without the need for any tools, the Henry U.S. Survival AR-7 is ready for action.

 The Henry U.S. Survival AR-7 comes standard with a sturdy steel barrel covered in tough ABS plastic and then coated with Teflon for complete protection against corrosion. Plus, it's engineered for perfect balance and the ability to maintain its tack-driving accuracy, even after thousands of rounds.

 Henry US Survival in the wild
 Like the barrel, the receiver is also coated with a layer of waterproof Teflon for superior weatherproofing, waterproof protection, even in harsh salt water environments. Plus, the updated receiver is grooved making it easy to top it off with your favorite optics.

 The Henry U.S. Survival AR-7 is available in Black and Camo finishs. All models are equipped with an adjustable rear sight and a blade front sight.

title: For Sale:  D-Technik Czech VZ58
postcontent:
VZ58, striker fire (like Glock pistol) 7.62x39 rifle with 10 mags.
This doesn't have the rotating bolt like an AK, but rather a striker fired pin like a Glock, so you stay on target without the "kick" you get from the rotating bolt, while shooting the same round as an AK47.
This is also a milled receiver, while being more "heavy duy" than a stamped AK, weighs 1LB. LESS than a stamped AK.
It is also more accurate than most AK's out there, while being a bit shorter in length, legal of course and easier to get on target.

D-Technik rifle, comes with 10 mags, and additional muzzle brake.
Very accurate.

THIS IS NOT THE CENTURY ARMS cheapo VZ2008 rifle.

No trades,

1918 Lee Enfield ShtLE MKIII* converted to .410 India Musket in 1933. This rifle is all original from the conversion, and is not chambered for commercial .410 shotshells. The wood and metal have seen better days and leaves me to conclude that this was not some arsenal surplus gun; this one was used. It has proof markings, manufacturer markings and cartouches all over it. Again this is not a safe queen. Ammunition for it is not readily available unfortunately. It has to be hand made from 303 British cartridges (if you want I can help you make some or give you instructions on how to). Basically I am just not interested in it much anymore and am looking at moving on to other projects. 

I am asking $250 for it but I am negotiable. I will entertain trades, specifically a mosin nagant with some ammo or a cheap 12ga. 

I am located in graham and will travel within reason for a deal.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1963 Belgian Browning Hi Power Safari Grade ~ Bring Trades!! ~ Rem 700, Rem 870, Win 70..
location: Near lake, Rock Hill, South Carolina
postcontent:
This is a Belgian made Browning Hi Power Safari Grade bolt action rifle chambered in .264 win mag. 264 win mag is more powerful than 270, for those that aren't familiar with this caliber. The stock has some wear, but it can be refinished to new condition for $150ish. The barrel and action are in good condition and the blueing is nice. 

As for the scope:
It is a collectible Browning 4X rimfire scope made by Redfield. It has the ¾” tube. It is in great condition and has no damage. Crosshairs and glass are crisp and clear. 

This Browning 4x Rimfire scope was made between 1965 and 1976. FOV is 24 feet at 100 yards. Evidently when these scopes were marketed under the Redfield name they were called the Sport-STER 4. The STER apparently stood for Standard Eye Relief. The Browning ocular bell was smooth- not a serrated 3-ring design like Redfield. Otherwise, it’s supposed to be the same scope.

The ocular bell diameter is 1.15” and the objective bell diameter is 1.10”. Overall length is 9 1/8”. The diminutive dimensions make for a really nice look on any rifle and the optical quality with the fine cross hairs is on a par with newer scopes in this price range.

According to “Old Gunsights And Rifle Scopes” by Nick Stroebel (2008), the value was $150-$300 at publication. As you might imagine, they are becoming more desirable as time passes and, when you can find them, they are currently selling for about $250 - $325.



I am really looking to trade. I'd love to do a 241 for this rifle for a shotgun and another rifle. My trade interests are below.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1963 Belgian Browning Hi Power Safari Grade ~ Bring Trades!! Rem 700, Rem 870, Win 70..
location: Rock Hill, Rock Hill, South Carolina
postcontent:
This is a Belgian made Browning Hi Power Safari Grade bolt action rifle chambered in .264 win mag. 264 win mag is more powerful than 270, for those that aren't familiar with this caliber. The stock has some wear, but it can be refinished to new condition for $150ish. The barrel and action are in good condition and the blueing is nice. 

As for the scope:
It is a collectible Browning 4X rimfire scope made by Redfield. It has the ¾” tube. It is in great condition and has no damage. Crosshairs and glass are crisp and clear. 

This Browning 4x Rimfire scope was made between 1965 and 1976. FOV is 24 feet at 100 yards. Evidently when these scopes were marketed under the Redfield name they were called the Sport-STER 4. The STER apparently stood for Standard Eye Relief. The Browning ocular bell was smooth- not a serrated 3-ring design like Redfield. Otherwise, it’s supposed to be the same scope.

The ocular bell diameter is 1.15” and the objective bell diameter is 1.10”. Overall length is 9 1/8”. The diminutive dimensions make for a really nice look on any rifle and the optical quality with the fine cross hairs is on a par with newer scopes in this price range.

According to “Old Gunsights And Rifle Scopes” by Nick Stroebel (2008), the value was $150-$300 at publication. As you might imagine, they are becoming more desirable as time passes and, when you can find them, they are currently selling for about $250 - $325.



I am really looking to trade. I'd love to do a 241 for this rifle for a shotgun and another rifle. My trade interests are below.

Shotguns:
12ga Remington 870 

Bolt action Rifles: 
Calibers: 243, 25-06, 270, 300BLK, 308, 30-30, 30-06, 7mm rem mag

title: For Sale:  Tula Ex-Sniper Mosin Nagant 91/30
postcontent:
For sale is a highly desirable ex sniper mosin nagant.  Adding to this, it's also a Tula Arsenal gun.  1943 date.  Notice in the pictures the "CH" designation above the Tula star.  This was the sniper stamp used by that arsenal.  Furthermore, you can see the plugged holes from the inside shot of the receiver.  This was where the PU scope mounted to the rifle.

This isn't a run of the mill 91/30.  This has collectors value.  Could be left alone as an ex-sniper, or some guys have the bolt turned down and find an original scope to turn them back to their original glory.  Either way, its a nice rifle with good rifling and no counterbore.  

As such, the price is firm at $200 cash.  The only trade considered would be a NIB Ruger 10/22.

title: For Sale:  Adams Arms Carbine Length Piston AR15 Upper NEW .223 / 5.56
postcontent:
For sale is a new Adams Arms Carbine Length Piston AR-15 Upper receiver. Been in the safe, haven't even cleaned off the factory oil.

Specs:
Upper Receiver: A4 Flat-Top, Forged
Barrel Length: 16"
Barrel Contour: Government
Barrel Material: 4150 Chrome Moly Vanadium Steel
Muzzle Thread Pattern: 1/2"-28
Chrome Lined: No
Barrel Finish: QPQ Melonite / Black Nitride
Twist Rate: 1 in 7"
Chamber: 5.56x45mm NATO
M4 Feed Ramps: Yes
Bolt Carrier: 1-Piece w/Integral Piston Strike Face
Muzzle Device: A2 Flash Hider
Gas System Length: Carbine, Short Stroke Piston Operated
Gas Block Diameter: 0.750"
Handguard: 2-Piece Polymer, Mid-Length


Complete Base upper receiver assembly comes ready to install on mil-spec lower receiver to produce a reliable, positive-cycling gas piston gun. Adams Arms’ proven piston system doesn’t vent hot gases and burned powder into the bolt carrier and receiver, so the gun runs cooler, with less fouling and wear on the action, and easier maintenance. Short-stroke piston shaft eliminates concussive gas expansion in the upper receiver for less violent cycling, smoother feeding, and reduced felt recoil. The receiver is forged from 6061 T6 aluminum and features M4 feed ramp cuts and a 13-slot Picatinny-cut flattop rail. The adjustable gas block allows three levels of gas release: normal fire, firing with a suppressor attached, or a single round fired without cycling. Picatinny rail on top of gas block accepts a variety of clamp-on tactical sights. All models have melonite-lined barrels chambered for 5.56mm NATO, with an A2 flash hider and a black Melonite® finish for superb wear resistance and up to 60% more corrosion resistance than traditional phosphate coating.

Slap on sights and a lower and you're good to go. Email with questions. Trades considered.

title: For Sale:  MO and KS CCW, Firearms Training, and Safety Training
location: KC North, Smithville, Saint Joseph, Kansas City, Missouri
postcontent:
I am hosting a Concealed Carry Course on the 7th of June north of the river off 92 hwy just west of Smithville.   I have several seats open to Missouri and Kansas residents.   I am a 24 year veteran of the Army and 17 year Police Officer.  I have been teaching police officers and Soldiers for several years to ensure they are prepared for the streets as well as combat.

I teach the state required training as well as teach tactics and carry options. 

I am also able to teach advanced courses, low Light,  carbines, and shotguns. 

If your unable to attend this course I can come to you if you want to host or we can set up another with my facilities.   If you want to host you must have room to run a range and have at least 6 or more friends. 

Military $70 with my guns and ammo
Public $100 or bring two friends $85 each with my guns and ammo
Bring your own guns and ammo $50 80 rounds (40 revolver/ 40 semi auto)

Thanks Adam

Call, text, or email for more information or to get a seat
